info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 17 at 8:34PM EDT until April 19 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to a foot or so possible over the higher terrain. Valleys will see less snowfall. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Northern Wayne county. In New York, Oneida, Madison, Chenango, Otsego, Delaware and Sullivan counties. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Roads may quickly become snow covered and travel could become very difficult. Power outages will be possible especially over the higher terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mixture of rain and snow will spread over the watch area Monday afternoon. The precipitation will change to snow Monday evening. The snow could become heavy at times overnight before tapering to a mix of rain and snow showers Tuesday morning. The snow will be heavy and wet and could cause power outages in addition to travel difficulties.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
